definition: game where the last word of one idiom 成語|成语[cheng2 yu3] is the first of the next
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
Chinese set expression, typically of 4 characters, often alluding to a story or historical quotation/idiom/proverb/saying/adage/CL:條|条[tiao2],本[ben3],句[ju4]
The Moment of Truth (TV show)/Truth or Dare (game)
pinyin: Zhen1 xin1 hua4 Da4 Mao4 xian3

definition: saying in which the second part, uttered after a pause or totally left out, is the intended meaning of the allegory presented in the first part
one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp/sporadic effort/short attention span
pattern matching (puzzle game)/matching (type of test question in which presented items are to be paired up)
a thousand tries leads to one success (idiom, humble expr.); Even without any notable ability on my part, I may still get it right sometimes by good luck.
